SEARCH
Module fi.tuni.environmentaldatalogger
Package fi.tuni.environmentaldatalogger.apis

Class WeatherDataExtractor

java.lang.Object
fi.tuni.environmentaldatalogger.apis.WeatherDataExtractor
All Implemented Interfaces:
DataExtractor
public class WeatherDataExtractor extends Object implements DataExtractor
WeatherDataExtractor class implements DataExtractor interface to fetch weather data from an API. It handles fetching both current and historical weather data, cache management, and data formatting.

    • getValidParameters

      public ArrayList<String> getValidParameters()
      Retrieves a list of valid parameters that can be queried from the weather API. These parameters include weather-related measurements such as temperature and humidity.
      Specified by:
      getValidParameters in interface DataExtractor
      Returns:
      A list of strings representing the valid parameters.

    • getValidDataRange

      public javafx.util.Pair<LocalDateTime,LocalDateTime> getValidDataRange(ArrayList<String> params)
      Provides the valid range of dates for which data can be retrieved from the weather API. This range is dependent on the API's data availability.
      Specified by:
      getValidDataRange in interface DataExtractor
      Parameters:
      params - A list of parameters for which the data range is to be determined.
      Returns:
      A Pair object containing the start and end LocalDateTime of the valid data range.

    • getData

      public TreeMap<String,TreeMap<LocalDateTime,Double>> getData(ArrayList<String> params, javafx.util.Pair<LocalDateTime,LocalDateTime> range, Coordinate coordinates) throws ApiException
      Retrieves weather data for a given set of parameters, date range, and geographical coordinates. This method fetches data either from the cache or the API, depending on data availability.
      Specified by:
      getData in interface DataExtractor
      Parameters:
      params - A list of parameters for which data is requested.
      range - A Pair representing the start and end LocalDateTime for the requested data range.
      coordinates - The geographical coordinates for the location of interest.
      Returns:
      A TreeMap mapping parameter names to another TreeMap of LocalDateTime to values.
      Throws:
      ApiException - If there is an error in data retrieval or processing.

    • getCurrentData

      public TreeMap<String,Double> getCurrentData(ArrayList<String> params, Coordinate coordinates) throws ApiException
      Fetches the current weather data for the specified parameters and geographical coordinates. This method retrieves real-time weather data from the API.
      Specified by:
      getCurrentData in interface DataExtractor
      Parameters:
      params - A list of parameters for which current data is requested.
      coordinates - The geographical coordinates for the location of interest.
      Returns:
      A TreeMap mapping parameter names to their current values.
      Throws:
      ApiException - If there is an error in the API call.

    • getUnit

      public String getUnit(String param)
      Provides the unit of measurement for a given weather parameter. This method returns the appropriate unit, such as degrees Celsius or percentage, for the specified parameter.
      Specified by:
      getUnit in interface DataExtractor
      Parameters:
      param - The parameter for which the unit is requested.
      Returns:
      A string representing the unit of measurement for the parameter.

    • getCurrentIcon

      public String getCurrentIcon(Coordinate coordinates) throws ApiException
      Retrieves the current weather icon based on the geographical coordinates. This method makes an API call to fetch the current weather conditions and extracts the icon data. The icon represents the current weather visually, such as sunny, cloudy, rainy, etc.
      Parameters:
      coordinates - The geographical coordinates for which the current weather icon is required.
      Returns:
      A string representing the weather icon. Returns null if the icon is not available in the response.
      Throws:
      ApiException - If there is an error in the API call or response parsing.
